column4: Let's try another way - what's the easiest way to add/remove programs in ubuntu?
one more vote fot apt-get
dpkg --purge foo to remove
system > admin > synaptic if you like guis
It's a new install, and I don't have menu items that the help references.
system > admin > synaptic should even be present in a new install
Nope.
weird
sudo adduser foo admin
That doesn't seem to work.  e.g., sudo visudo returns nothing.
sudo adduser foo admin  no visudo
sudo adduser --- admin doesn't work
are you running this from your primary user account?
It's the only user account.
can that user sudo for other things?
sudo gedit /root/deleteme
Nothing.
then type gibberish, then try to save
That command returns nothing - nothing happens
Doesn't call gedit.
it's possible your sudo is broken
boot to recovery mode
